com.facebook.data.datumdigest

Class DatumMurmur3Hash

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.data.datumdigest.DatumMurmur3Hash
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DatumDigest, DigestFunction<Datum>

    public class DatumMurmur3Hash
extends Object
implements DatumDigest, DigestFunction<Datum>
    takes Datums and delegates to a hash function pair: f1: long -> long f2: byte[] -> long f2 has an option: internally, it produces 128 bit hash, so you can ask to use the upper or lower 8 bytes. The default is the lower 8 bytes. For random hashing, in practice it does not matter.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DatumMurmur3Hash() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long computeDigest(Datum input) 
      static DatumMurmur3Hash useLsb()
      for the case that input is not long-compatible and directly produces a long as a hash value, we get a 128 bit hash.
      static DatumMurmur3Hash useMsb()
      for the case that input is not long-compatible and directly produces a long as a hash value, we get a 128 bit hash.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • useLsb

        public static DatumMurmur3Hash useLsb()
        for the case that input is not long-compatible and directly produces a long as a hash value, we get a 128 bit hash. This means use the lower 8 bytes as the long to return
        Returns:
        digest that will use lower 8 bytes

      • useMsb

        public static DatumMurmur3Hash useMsb()
        for the case that input is not long-compatible and directly produces a long as a hash value, we get a 128 bit hash. This means use the upper 8 bytes as the long to return
        Returns:
        digest that will use upper 8 bytes
